intro: Tuckermannia, commonly known as the fairy sedge, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Cyperaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are perennial herbs characterized by their grass-like appearance. The plants typically grow in wet or marshy habitats, often in temperate regions. Tuckermannia species have narrow, linear leaves and produce small, clustered flower heads. They are valued in ecological restoration projects due to their ability to stabilize soil and support biodiversity.
